entry.title: UMPQUA MAN JAILED FOR ALLEGED MENACING INCIDENT
entry.summary: November 24, 2024 3:40 p.m. An Umpqua man was jailed for an alleged menacing incident on Saturday night. entry.title: South Umpqua High School celebrates Thanksgiving
entry.summary: Every year before Thanksgiving, Hannah McKelvey and Jamie Wise shared a Thanksgiving lunch at South Umpqua High School, a tradition they’ve kept since their freshman year

entry.title: Umpqua Banks holds Warm Hearts Winter Drive
entry.summary: Umpqua Bank opened its 10th Annual Warm Hearts Winter Drive, an associate-driven campaign to support individuals, families and youths who struggle with access to housing and other basic resources.

entry.title: Roseburg Public Library holds STEAM activity for kids
entry.summary: Roseburg kids brushed up on their chemistry skills by making slime and putty during a S.T.E.A.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math) activity event Thursday at Roseburg Public Library.

entry.title: DCSO SEEKING MISSING GLENDALE MAN
entry.summary: November 22, 2024 1:30 p.m. Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office are seeking information on a missing Glendale man. Lieutenant Brad O’Dell said 72-year-old Donald Burrows was last heard from on November 15th, when he spoke to family from his home on his landline phone. entry.title: Lean into Lentils with Red Lentil Flatbreads
entry.summary: Cooler weather calls for hearty, gratifying foods. The question is how to have fun creating meals that satisfy hunger while also supporting good health. Here is a great suggestion: lentils.

entry.title: Diamond Lake Resort opens tubing hill this weekend
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — For the first time in years, Diamond Lake Resort will open the tubing hill for Thanksgiving weekend if the weather allows.

entry.summary: Two segments: Tabbitha Layman of the Roseburg Rotary Club talks about the Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights, and Umpqua Valley Winegrowers Executive Director Ali Rodgers talks about the Thanksgiving Weekend Open House at many area wineries.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR MULTIPLE WARRANTS
entry.summary: November 22, 2024 9:40 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a woman for multiple warrants on Thursday. An RPD report said at 9:55 a.m. officers contacted the 33-year-old in the 1400 block of Southeast Mill Street regarding the warrants for her arrest. She was taken into custody on five warrants. Bail was set at $28,750.

entry.title: Nevada man allegedly steals another truck upon release from jail.
entry.summary: Steven Timothy Gant, of Reno is back in Douglas County Jail after continuing his journey home by allegedly stealing another vehicle Wednesday. Gant was initially arrested Monday night in possession of a truck stolen from Washington according to police.

entry.title: Elkton Art and Wine Weekend returns for 14th year
entry.summary: For those in Douglas County looking for another way to welcome in the holiday season after Thanksgiving, Elkton will be hosting the 14th Annual Art and Wine Weekend to show off the community's artisan goods and viticulture.

entry.title: ROSEBURG WAY AHEAD FOR NOVEMBER RAINFALL
entry.summary: November 22, 2024 4:00 a.m. Roseburg is way ahead for November rainfall, with the month two-thirds over. Data from the National Weather Service said as of Wednesday, 6.12 inches of rain has been recorded this month at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The normal amount is 3.07 inches. The record for this point in November is...

entry.title: TICKETS AVAILABLE FOR FISHERY ENHANCEMENT DINNER AND AUCTION
entry.summary: November 22, 2024 3:05 a.m. Tickets are now available for the Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby dinner and auction. entry.title: COMMERCIAL DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON DELAYED
entry.summary: November 22, 2024 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife has announced that the states commercial Dungeness crab season is delayed coastwide until at least December 16th. An ODFW release said pre-season testing shows Dungeness crabs are too low in meat yield in some ocean areas and have elevated domoic acid in crab...

entry.title: Moving day for unhoused campers at The Point
entry.summary: Wednesday was moving day from "The Point" back across the foot-bridge to Deer Creek Park as camp sites posted by the Roseburg Police Department for removal reached the 7 a.m. deadline. Meanwhile, more than 60 tents had already been erected…
